conversations.content: H-hello? Let me in, please! They're going to kill me!
Who could that be?
Sounds like he's in quite the predicament.
We'd better let him in—we can find out what's going on later.
*pant* Whew! I thought I was done for...
What happened? Did you run into fiends or something?
Something far more terrifying...
Anyway, thanks for letting me in. You saved my life, friend!
Ah, but I haven't introduced myself yet,  have I? The name's Orion.
I'm something of a famous bodyguard around these parts.
I've been out on an escort mission today, in fact.
Sounds like you ran into trouble.
Indeed! A truly perilous love captured my heart and trapped it in its claws!
Er...love?
For today's mission, I was entrusted with escorting two stunningly beautiful siblings.
Alas, before the work was done, I'd fallen head over heels for both of them.
But who could blame me?
We were together through good times and bad, facing danger most foul as one... I was doomed from the outset!
Naturally, not wanting to hurt their delicate maiden hearts, I kept it secret from both of them that I was dating the other.
But once the escort mission came to an end, the two of them both asked about the future of our relationship at once! Which...did not end well.
When I truthfully replied that I intended to continue dating both of them, the sisters... Well, they tried to murder me. *cough*
The words ＂risking one's life for love＂ never rang so true!
It sounds to me like you're just reaping what you sowed.
But I never could have imagined that the castle I stumbled upon during my escape would contain such a lovely woman!
It's a miracle! ...Nay, fate!
What do you say, O sylvan beauty? Would you care to join me for lunch?
Euden?
Do you want to throw him back outside, or should I do it?
I can't throw someone back when there are two women waiting to murder him. ...No matter how much he deserves it.
Hmm? Oh my! There is a stunning young faerie on your shoulder!
Never have I cast my eyes upon such a  sweet maiden as thee!
Will you do me the honor of joining me for a cup of tea?
You would be more than welcome to join us, my sylvan sweetheart.
Out. Now.
I'll get the catapult.
You can't! I'll be torn limb from limb by those two stunning beauties outside! ...Which, to be honest, is a pretty good way to go, but—
Look...Orion, was it?
If you want, you can stay here until those women get bored and leave.
I am in your debt!
Hey, Euden!
How'd ya manage to get the famous Orion to join up?
He came to our door, actually.
But what do you mean by ＂famous＂?
I wasn't aware you knew him.
Course I know him! Ain't many in my line'a work what don't.
He's a top-class bodyguard.
Guy's never let a target get hurt—not once.
Wow. I had no idea.
In that case, I should ask him to guard me.
No, wait! He ain't gonna...
Aaand he's gone.
Well, unless everything I heard about the guy's a lie, he ain't gonna accept...
Orion, do you have a minute?
Can it wait?
I was about to ask Cleo to join me for a little lunch.
You're not going to have much luck there. She went into town to do the shopping.
What?! Ugh.
Well, what of fair Elisanne? Where is she?
With Cleo. Anyway, getting to the point...
I'm thinking I need a bodyguard, and I hear you're the best in the business.
Sorry, but no dice.
Can I ask why not?
I have one absolute condition for being someone's bodyguard:
they have to be a woman.
I'm grateful that you're letting me stay here—really, I am.
But that's my one rule, and I won't change it for you or anyone.
The whole reason I do this job is because it creates romance worth risking my life for.
So you work as a bodyguard in order to fall in love?
Yup. That's why I only escort women.
Not that you're not attractive or anything, but my heart just pulls me in that direction.
Huh. Well, fair enough.
If that's how you feel, I won't press it.
I'm glad you understand.
Incidentally, are YOU in love right now,  Euden?
I'm afraid I don't have much experience with that sort of thi—
What a waste! A youth without love is a youth thrown away!
The end of your life can come at any time.
So when love takes root in your heart, you should tell the object of your affections straight away.
That's how I've always handled it.
I'll bear that in mind.
As such, I must hurry into town and tell Elisanne and Cleo how I feel!
Ahh... Today is such a lovely day.
It's so peaceful and calm... This is bliss.
What brought that on?
Orion has been constantly badgering me to the point of near insanity, but today I haven't seen hide nor hair of the man.
I'm enjoying this fleeting peace while it lasts.
That DOES sound annoying. I don't think he's a bad guy all in all, but he sure needs to learn how to take a hint.
It sounds like he's started taking on new escort jobs again, though.
So maybe he'll be bothering you less.
I certainly hope so.
Oh, speak of the devil. He's back.
I...return...
Orion, what happened?! You're hurt!
It's...nothing... I finished...the job...
There were no proble— GYAAA!
I hope you didn't end up incurring another girl's wrath by cheating on her.
...Regardless, let me take a look.
Th-thanks... Urk!
Hmm? This wound doesn't look like it was made by a human.
It looks like the kind of damage you'd receive from a fiend's claw.
Yes. I was escorting a lady when a fiend  showed up out of nowhere and made to attack her.
It was so sudden, I had no choice but to use myself as a shield.
Call it an honorable wound, I guess, for I have no regrets.
You let a fiend attack you head-on?!
Unbelievable.
I didn't have any other option.
It was the only way to ensure her safety.
You truly are mad. You know this, yes?
You could have died.
And what a shame THAT would have been.
I still haven't managed to get you and  Elisanne to have lunch with me!
But I wanted the lady I was escorting to die even less.
I can't very well ask a dead woman out on a date, after all.
Well, THAT'S grim.
Still, I guess you're not all talk about this whole ＂protection＂ business.
You really are a first-rate bodyguard.
...Even if your motives are pure as the driven slush.
I haven't taken you seriously since you arrived here—and have, in fact, said some very unkind things about you.
It seems I may have been wrong, and for that, I apologize.
Hearing that from you makes being hurt like this feel completely worth it.
So what do you say about getting dinner tonight with just the two of u—
OWWWW!
I'm disinfecting your wound. This is going to hurt—enough that you won't be able to crack wise for a while.
Gya! Ooof! I really don't think it should hurt quite this mu— AAAAAARGH!
Oh, Euden.
I'm off to take care of another escort job.
Can I ask you to tell Cleo and Elisanne not to feel too lonely while I'm away?
Sure, I'll do tha— Hey, wait!
You're going out on a job? You're not fully healed yet!
Alas, no. But so long as there are women who need me, I have no choice but to answer their call.
Any chance I can change your mind?
No.
Nothing you can say will sway me when new love awaits!
I figured as much.
In that case, I'm coming with you.
You need someone to watch your back if you're not in prime fighting shape.
You are a strange one indeed. Most people would be shaking their head at this point.
This may be the first time I've ever felt thankful toward a man. Ha ha!
But I suppose I'll take you up on your offer. There's no harm in letting yourself be protected every once in a while.
...Whew! We did it.
Fighting while protecting someone is a  lot more tiring than fighting normally.
Are you all right, my fair maiden?
I'm fine. Thank you soooo much!
Wow. He's amazing.
All that fighting, and he's not even out of breath—and still able to try and sweet-talk his charge!
We're almost at our destination, my lady.
Once we arrive there, my work will— alas—be done.
Yet the thought of letting our relationship end as a purely business one pains me so!
What would you say to a cup of tea with me upon our arrival?
Heh. He might actually have too much energy for his own good.
...Is your work always this hard, Orion?
Honestly, this is one of the simplest jobs I've done—especially with your help.
Some of my worst jobs have involved dealing with swarming hordes of fiends, or bandits, or even assassins.
You can't possibly be THAT obsessed with falling in love.
Ah, but I am. For you see, I'm afflicted with a curse where I will die if I don't fall in love with my soul mate.
A...curse?
And I'm not the only one afflicted by it— indeed, we all are.
What do you mean?
Listen well, my friend: A life of never knowing love is no life at all.
All of us suffer from the same curse as I.
If we don't fall in love with our destiny, our lives are cursed to not be worth living.
Part of me sooort of gets that, but I really feel like you're just dodging the question.
Still, even if you're doing all this because of a curse, the love you feel for them IS genuine, right?
My feelings are always genuine.
Enough talking. We should get back.
The ladies of the castle must be dying to  be reunited with me!
Good morning, Euden! It's a beautiful day, is it not?
It sure is.
Er, but can I ask why you've been coming to see me so often lately?
To be your bodyguard, of course.
Sorry, I'm confused.
That's what you wanted, yes?
Well, yes...
But I thought you only worked for women?
That USED to be my policy.
But you protected me the other day, and I need to return the favor.
Of course, if one of the lovely ladies of this world needs my aid, that will have to take priority.
But when there's no such request, I'll be here protecting you.
...Really? Well, thanks. That's actually incredibly reassuring.
You may not be a woman, but you ARE more than worthy of being protected— so I will give this job my all!
Besides, by protecting you, I am indirectly protecting the women around you.
Hmm? What do you mean?
If anything was to happen to you, it would break the hearts of all the women who love you.
To think of those grieving faces... Ah! That alone is too much to bear!
The women who...love me? You mean romantically? Because I'm pretty sure there aren't any of those here.
...You really haven't noticed?
You're a pitiful excuse for a man. You know this, right?
Don't you agree, ladies?
Wh-wh-what are you talking about?! I bear no such feelings toward Euden!
I think fondly of him as a friend working  toward a shared goal. That is all.
Y-yes! That's it exactly!
Naturally, I think fondly of him in that sense.
All I was asking was whether the two of you agreed. I wasn't suggesting that you personally had romantic feelings for him.
What are you getting so flustered about?
I AM NOT FLUSTERED, SIR!
It boggles the mind: here I am, completely available, and yet the ladies flock to you.
Yet somehow...I don't feel jealous.
After spending so much time with you, I've come to realize that you possess a certain charm that I lack.
After all, you're the first man I've ever felt the need to protect.
I thought you said you weren't planning on falling in love with any men.
You really are slow when it comes to these matters! I'm just trying to say that you are more charming than you know.
No. Never mind. I owe you, but not enough to set you up in a relationship.
All I want to say is that you can count on me to have your back!
Heh. If that's all you wanted to say, you could have just said it.
But don't worry—I've got your back, too.
